cards.name: Air Elemental
cards.text: Flying
cards.flavor: As insubstantial, and as powerful, as the wind that carries it.
cards.original_text: Flying

cards.name: Blizzard Elemental
cards.text:
Flying
{3}{U}: Untap Blizzard Elemental.
cards.flavor: Students who had seen Rayne argue with Urza were certain she had summoned it to make him seem warmer by comparison.
cards.original_text:
Flying
{3}{U}: Untap Blizzard Elemental.

cards.name: Brainstorm
cards.text: Draw three cards, then put two cards from your hand on top of your library in any order.
cards.flavor:
"I reeled from the blow, and then suddenly, I knew exactly what to do. Within moments victory was mine."
—Gustha Ebbasdotter
Kjeldoran royal mage
cards.original_text: Draw three cards, then put two cards from your hand on top of your library in any order.

rulings.text: You draw three cards and put two cards back all while Brainstorm is resolving. Nothing can happen between the two, and no player may choose to take actions.

cards.name: Cloud Djinn
cards.text:
Flying
Cloud Djinn can block only creatures with flying.
cards.flavor:
As elusive as the footprint of a djinn
—Suq'Ata expression
cards.original_text:
Flying
Cloud Djinn can block only creatures with flying.

cards.name: Cloud Elemental
cards.text:
Flying
Cloud Elemental can block only creatures with flying.
cards.flavor:
"You know you've angered the gods when the clouds turn against you."
—Sisay, Captain of the Weatherlight
cards.original_text:
Flying
Cloud Elemental can block only creatures with flying.

cards.name: Counterspell
cards.text: Counter target spell.
cards.original_text: Counter target spell.

cards.name: Fog Elemental
cards.text:
Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
When Fog Elemental attacks or blocks, sacrifice it at end of combat.
cards.flavor:
"I've seen fog so thick you could cut it, but none that could cut me."
—Tahngarth of the Weatherlight
cards.original_text:
Flying
When Fog Elemental attacks or blocks, sacrifice it at end of combat.

cards.name: Gaseous Form
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt to and dealt by enchanted creature.
cards.flavor:
"It's hard to hurt anyone when you're as transparent as your motives."
—Ertai, wizard adept
cards.original_text: Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt to and dealt by enchanted creature.

rulings.text: The enchanted creature can still attack and block.

cards.name: Giant Crab
cards.text: {U}: Giant Crab gains shroud until end of turn. (It can't be the target of spells or abilities.)
cards.flavor: During the giant crabs' mating season, Skyshroud nights are filled with the clatter of their skirmishes.
cards.original_text: {U}: Giant Crab can't be the target of spells or abilities this turn.

cards.name: Impulse
cards.text: Look at the top four cards of your library. Put one of them into your hand and the rest on the bottom of your library in any order.
cards.flavor:
"Controlling time ensures you need never look impulsive again."
—Teferi
cards.original_text: Look at the top four cards of your library. Put one of them into your hand and the rest on the bottom of your library.

rulings.text: This is not a draw.
Due to errata, you no longer shuffle your library.

cards.name: Killer Whale
cards.text: {U}: Killer Whale gains flying until end of turn.
cards.flavor: Hunger is like the sea: deep, endless, and unforgiving.
cards.original_text: {U}: Killer Whale gains flying until end of turn.

cards.name: Leviathan
cards.text:
Trample
Leviathan enters the battlefield tapped and doesn't untap during your untap step.
At the beginning of your upkeep, you may sacrifice two Islands. If you do, untap Leviathan.
Leviathan can't attack unless you sacrifice two Islands. (This cost is paid as attackers are declared.)
cards.original_text:
Trample
Leviathan comes into play tapped and doesn't untap during your untap step.
At the beginning of your upkeep, you may sacrifice two islands. If you do, untap Leviathan.
Leviathan can't attack unless you sacrifice two islands.

rulings.text: You don't have to pay the untap cost if it is untapped outside the upkeep phase or is untapped by an effect.

cards.name: Mahamoti Djinn
cards.text: Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
cards.flavor: Of royal blood among the spirits of the air, the Mahamoti djinn rides on the wings of the winds. As dangerous in the gambling hall as he is in battle, he is a master of trickery and misdirection.
cards.original_text: Flying

cards.name: Power Sink
cards.text: Counter target spell unless its controller pays {X}. If that player doesn't, they tap all lands with mana abilities they control and lose all unspent mana.
cards.original_text: Counter target spell unless its controller pays {X}. If he or she doesn't, that player taps all lands he or she controls and empties his or her mana pool.

rulings.text: Does not increase the mana cost of the spell. It just requires a separate expenditure in order for it to succeed.

When this spell resolves, you either pay X mana or let your lands become tapped. The lands that become tapped are not "tapped for mana". If you choose to pay, you may pay the X mana using whatever mana abilities you want to use.

Only lands that actually have mana abilities will get tapped. This includes basic lands and lands with mana abilities printed on them, as well as lands which have been granted a mana ability by some effect.

cards.name: Snapping Drake
cards.text: Flying
cards.flavor: Drakes claim to be dragons—until the dragons show up.
cards.original_text: Flying

cards.name: Tolarian Winds
cards.text: Discard all the cards in your hand, then draw that many cards.
cards.flavor: Afterward, Tolaria's winds were like the whispers of lost wizards, calling for life.
cards.original_text: Discard your hand, then draw that many cards.

rulings.text: It counts how many cards you discard. Since this card will not be in your hand at that time, this card is not counted.

cards.name: Vigilant Drake
cards.text:
Flying
{2}{U}: Untap Vigilant Drake.
cards.flavor: Awake and awing in the blink of an eye.
cards.original_text:
Flying
{2}{U}: Untap Vigilant Drake.

cards.name: Wayward Soul
cards.text:
Flying
{U}: Put Wayward Soul on top of its owner's library.
cards.flavor:
"no home    no heart    no hope"
—Stronghold graffito
cards.original_text:
Flying
{U}: Put Wayward Soul on top of its owner's library.

cards.name: Bone Harvest
cards.text:
Put any number of target creature cards from your graveyard on top of your library.
Draw a card at the beginning of the next turn's upkeep.
cards.flavor:
"Only fools believe they will face my armies but once."
—Kaervek
cards.original_text:
Put any number of target creature cards from your graveyard on top of your library.
Draw a card at the beginning of the next turn's upkeep.

rulings.text: You have to show which creature cards you put on top of your library, but not the order you put them there.

cards.name: Coercion
cards.text: Target opponent reveals their hand. You choose a card from it. That player discards that card.
cards.flavor:
"There's very little that escapes me, Greven. And you will escape very little if you fail."
—Volrath
cards.original_text: Look at target opponent's hand and choose a card from it. That player discards that card.

cards.name: Dark Ritual
cards.text: Add {B}{B}{B}.
cards.original_text: Add {B}{B}{B} to your mana pool.

cards.name: Death Stroke
cards.text: Destroy target tapped creature.
cards.flavor: For a sharp second, Selenia froze, and Crovax's blade found home, As the angel shattered like glass, Crovax felt his mind collapse—the curse had been fulfilled.
cards.original_text: Destroy target tapped creature.

cards.name: Diabolic Edict
cards.text: Target player sacrifices a creature.
cards.flavor: Greven il-Vec lifted Vhati off his feet. "The fall will give you time to think on your failure."
cards.original_text: Target player sacrifices a creature.

cards.name: Drain Life
cards.text:
Spend only black mana on X.
Drain Life deals X damage to any target. You gain life equal to the damage dealt, but not more life than the player's life total before the damage was dealt, the planeswalker's loyalty before the damage was dealt, or the creature's toughness.
cards.original_text:
Spend only black mana on {X}.
Drain Life deals X damage to target creature or player. You gain life equal to the damage dealt, but not more life than the player's life total before Drain Life dealt damage or the creature's toughness.

rulings.text: Cost reducers can be used to reduce the X part of the mana cost.
You may gain up to the total toughness of the creature even if it was already damaged.

cards.name: Fallen Angel
cards.text:
Flying
Sacrifice a creature: Fallen Angel gets +2/+1 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: "Angels are simply extensions of truth upon the fabric of life—and there is far more dark than light." —Baron Sengir
cards.original_text:
Flying
Sacrifice a creature: Fallen Angel gets +2/+1 until end of turn.

rulings.text: Can sacrifice itself.

cards.name: Feral Shadow
cards.text: Flying
cards.flavor:
"The nightstalkers are such a minor power in Urborg. Their sad eagerness to elevate themselves makes them willing tools in the plundering of little Femeref."
—Kaervek
cards.original_text: Flying

cards.name: Gravedigger
cards.text: When Gravedigger enters the battlefield, you may return target creature card from your graveyard to your hand.
cards.flavor: A full coffin is like a full coffer—both are attractive to thieves.
cards.original_text: When Gravedigger comes into play, you may return target creature card from your graveyard to your hand.

rulings.text: A "creature card" is any card with the type creature, even if it has other types such as artifact, enchantment, or land. Older cards of type summon are also creature cards.

cards.name: Hollow Dogs
cards.text: Whenever Hollow Dogs attacks, it gets +2/+0 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: A hollow dog is never empty. It is filled with thirst for the hunt.
cards.original_text: Whenever Hollow Dogs attacks, it gets +2/+0 until end of turn.

rulings.text: If it attacks more than once per turn, it gets the bonus each time.

cards.name: Sengir Vampire
cards.text:
Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
Whenever a creature dealt damage by Sengir Vampire this turn dies, put a +1/+1 counter on Sengir Vampire.
cards.original_text:
Flying
Whenever a creature dealt damage by Sengir Vampire this turn is put into a graveyard, put a +1/+1 counter on Sengir Vampire.

rulings.text: If Sengir Vampire deals nonlethal damage to a creature and then a different effect or damage source causes that creature to be put into a graveyard later in the turn, Sengir Vampire's ability will trigger and it will get a +1/+1 counter.

Each time a creature is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, check whether Sengir Vampire had dealt any damage to it at any time during that turn. If so, Sengir Vampire's ability will trigger. It doesn't matter who controlled the creature or whose graveyard it was put into.
If Sengir Vampire and a creature it dealt damage to are both put into a graveyard at the same time, Sengir Vampire's ability will trigger, but it will do nothing when it resolves.

cards.name: Skittering Horror
cards.text: When you cast a creature spell, sacrifice Skittering Horror.
cards.flavor:
"This monstrosity will do—for now."
—Davvol, Evincar of Rath
cards.original_text: When you play a creature spell, sacrifice Skittering Horror.

rulings.text: Triggers when you announce a creature spell, and will resolve before that creature is put onto the battlefield.

cards.name: Skittering Skirge
cards.text:
Flying
When you cast a creature spell, sacrifice Skittering Skirge.
cards.flavor: The imps' warbling cries echo through Phyrexia's towers like those of mourning doves in a cathedral.
cards.original_text:
Flying
When you play a creature spell, sacrifice Skittering Skirge.

rulings.text: The triggered ability triggers when the creature spell is cast, and it is put on the stack before any responses can be cast or activated. This ability will resolve before that creature enters the battlefield.
A "creature spell" is any spell with the type Creature, even if it has other types such as Artifact or Enchantment. Older cards of type Summon are also Creature spells.

cards.name: Tar Pit Warrior
cards.text: When Tar Pit Warrior becomes the target of a spell or ability, sacrifice it.
cards.flavor:
"The cyclops shrugged off savage blows, but casual insults made him weep."
—Azeworai, "The Cyclops who Couldn't"
cards.original_text: When Tar Pit Warrior becomes the target of a spell or ability, sacrifice Tar Pit Warrior.

cards.name: Terror
cards.text: Destroy target nonartifact, nonblack creature. It can't be regenerated.
cards.original_text: Destroy target nonartifact, nonblack creature. It can't be regenerated.

cards.name: Balduvian Horde
cards.text: When Balduvian Horde enters the battlefield, sacrifice it unless you discard a card at random.
cards.original_text: When Balduvian Horde comes into play, sacrifice it unless you discard a card at random from your hand.

rulings.text: You choose whether to discard or not on resolution. If not, then you sacrifice this card. You can choose to not discard even if you no longer control this card on resolution.

cards.name: Ball Lightning
cards.text:
Trample (This creature can deal excess combat damage to the player or planeswalker it's attacking.)
Haste (This creature can attack and {T} as soon as it comes under your control.)
At the beginning of the end step, sacrifice Ball Lightning.
cards.original_text:
Trample; haste (This creature may attack and {T} the turn it comes under your control.)
At end of turn, sacrifice Ball Lightning.

rulings.text: The creature is sacrificed at the end of every turn in which it is on the battlefield. There is no choice about what turn to sacrifice it.

cards.name: Bloodrock Cyclops
cards.text: Bloodrock Cyclops attacks each combat if able.
cards.flavor:
"He's big an' dumb an' ready to fight. A lot like ol' Hornhead here."
—Squee, goblin cabin hand,
scouting report
cards.original_text: Bloodrock Cyclops attacks each turn if able.

rulings.text: There is no penalty if it can't attack.

cards.name: Fireball
cards.text:
This spell costs {1} more to cast for each target beyond the first.
Fireball deals X damage divided evenly, rounded down, among any number of targets.
cards.original_text: Fireball deals X damage divided evenly, rounded down, among Y plus one target creatures and/or players.

rulings.text: For example, if X is 5 and you choose three target creatures, Fireball has a total cost of {7}{R} (even though its mana cost is just {5}{R} and its converted mana cost is 6). If those creatures are all still legal targets as Fireball resolves, it deals 1 damage to each of them.
You may cast Fireball with zero targets, regardless of the value chosen for X. If you do so, it will not be a targeted spell, and no damage will actually be dealt when it resolves.
Fireball's damage is divided as Fireball resolves, not as it's cast, because there are no choices involved. The division involves only targets that are still legal as Fireball resolves.
You can target more than X creatures. However, if the number of legal targets at the time Fireball resolves is greater than X, none of them will be dealt any damage.

cards.name: Hulking Cyclops
cards.text: Hulking Cyclops can't block.
cards.flavor: Anyone can get around a cyclops, but few can stand in its way.
cards.original_text: Hulking Cyclops can't block.

cards.name: Kird Ape
cards.text: Kird Ape gets +1/+2 as long as you control a Forest.
cards.original_text: Kird Ape gets +1/+2 as long as you control a forest.

cards.name: Lava Axe
cards.text: Lava Axe deals 5 damage to target player or planeswalker.
cards.flavor: "Catch!"
cards.original_text: Lava Axe deals 5 damage to target player.

cards.name: Lightning Bolt
cards.text: Lightning Bolt deals 3 damage to any target.
cards.original_text: Lightning Bolt deals 3 damage to target creature or player.

cards.name: Lowland Giant
cards.flavor: "Faugh!" snorted Tahngarth. "Why would it make a meal of something like you?" Squee looked relieved. "No," he continued, "you'd make a much better toothpick."

cards.name: Raging Goblin
cards.text: Haste (This creature can attack and {T} as soon as it comes under your control.)
cards.flavor: He raged at the world, at his family, at his life. But mostly he just raged.
cards.original_text: Haste (This creature may attack and {T} the turn it comes under your control.)

cards.name: Shivan Dragon
cards.text:
Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
{R}: Shivan Dragon gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: While it's true most dragons are cruel, the Shivan dragon seems to take particular glee in the misery of others, often tormenting its victims much like a cat plays with a mouse before delivering the final blow.
cards.original_text:
Flying
{R}: Shivan Dragon gets +1/+0 until end of turn.

cards.name: Shock
cards.text: Shock deals 2 damage to any target.
cards.flavor:
Lightning tethers souls to the world.
—Kor saying
cards.original_text: Shock deals 2 damage to target creature or player.

cards.name: Sonic Burst
cards.text:
As an additional cost to cast this spell, discard a card at random.
Sonic Burst deals 4 damage to any target.
cards.flavor: Music scythes the savage beast.
cards.original_text:
As an additional cost to play Sonic Burst, discard a card at random from your hand.
Sonic Burst deals 4 damage to target creature or player.

rulings.text: You can't discard more than once to target more than one creature (or player) or to do multiple amounts of damage to a single creature (or player).
You pick the target before you know which card is going to be discarded.

cards.name: Talruum Minotaur
cards.text: Haste
cards.flavor:
Don't insult a Talruum unless your mount is swift.
—Suq'Ata saying
cards.original_text: Haste (This creature may attack and {T} the turn it comes under your control.)

cards.name: Thunderbolt
cards.text:
Choose one —
• Thunderbolt deals 3 damage to target player or planeswalker.
• Thunderbolt deals 4 damage to target creature with flying.
cards.flavor:
"Most wizards consider a thunderbolt to be a proper retort."
—Ertai, wizard adept
cards.original_text: Choose one Thunderbolt deals 3 damage to target player; or Thunderbolt deals 4 damage to target creature with flying.

cards.name: Thundering Giant
cards.text: Haste (This creature can attack and {T} as soon as it comes under your control.)
cards.flavor: The giant was felt a few seconds before he was seen.
cards.original_text: Haste (This creature may attack and {T} the turn it comes under your control.)

cards.name: Viashino Warrior
cards.flavor:
"When traveling the Great Desert avoid wearing the scales of lizards, for the Viashino rule the sands and look poorly on the skinning of their cousins."
—Zhalfirin Guide to the Desert

cards.name: Crash of Rhinos
cards.text: Trample
cards.flavor:
Love is like a rhino, short-sighted and hasty; if it cannot find a way, it will make a way.
—Femeref adage
cards.original_text: Trample

cards.name: Crashing Boars
cards.text: Whenever Crashing Boars attacks, defending player chooses an untapped creature they control. That creature blocks Crashing Boars this turn if able.
cards.flavor: Bores ruin a party. Boars are party to ruin.
cards.original_text: Whenever Crashing Boars attacks, defending player chooses an untapped creature he or she controls. That creature blocks Crashing Boars this turn if able.

rulings.text: If the chosen creature is not still untapped at the time blockers are declared, it does not have to block.
The ability is not optional. If there are no untapped creatures to choose, then the ability does nothing.

cards.name: Deadly Insect
cards.text: Shroud (This creature can't be the target of spells or abilities.)
cards.flavor: With his newfound sense of self-importance, Squee set his sights on ever-bigger bugs.
cards.original_text: Deadly Insect can't be the target of spells or abilities.

cards.name: Erhnam Djinn
cards.text: At the beginning of your upkeep, target non-Wall creature an opponent controls gains forestwalk until your next upkeep. (It can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Forest.)
cards.original_text: At the beginning of your upkeep, target non—Wall creature an opponent controls gains forestwalk until your next upkeep. (The creature is unblockable as long as defending player controls a forest.)

rulings.text: In multiplayer games you can choose a different player's creature each upkeep. You are forced to pick a creature that some opponent controls if there is at least one creature on the battlefield that is a legal target.
If you have more than one Djinn, you can have all of them target the same creature with their ability.
If there are no creatures your opponent controls to target at the beginning of your upkeep, ignore this ability.

cards.name: Fog
cards.text: Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt this turn.
cards.original_text: Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt this turn.

cards.name: Force of Nature
cards.text:
Trample (This creature can deal excess combat damage to the player or planeswalker it's attacking.)
At the beginning of your upkeep, Force of Nature deals 8 damage to you unless you pay {G}{G}{G}{G}.
cards.original_text:
Trample
At the beginning of your upkeep, Force of Nature deals 8 damage to you unless you pay {G}{G}{G}{G}.

cards.name: Giant Growth
cards.text: Target creature gets +3/+3 until end of turn.
cards.original_text: Target creature gets +3/+3 until end of turn.

cards.name: Llanowar Elves
cards.text: {T}: Add {G}.
cards.flavor:
One bone broken for every twig snapped underfoot.
—Llanowar penalty for trespassing
cards.original_text: {T}: Add {G} to your mana pool.

cards.name: Plated Spider
cards.text: Reach (This creature can block creatures with flying.)
cards.flavor: Most spiders wait patiently for their prey to arrive. Most spiders aren't forty feet tall.
cards.original_text: Plated Spider may block as though it had flying.

rulings.text: This card now uses the Reach keyword ability to enable the blocking of flying creatures. This works because a creature with flying can only be blocked by creatures with flying or reach.

cards.name: Quirion Elves
cards.text:
As Quirion Elves enters the battlefield, choose a color.
{T}: Add {G}.
{T}: Add one mana of the chosen color.
cards.original_text:
As Quirion Elves comes into play, choose a color.
{T}: Add {G} to your mana pool.
{T}: Add one mana of the chosen color to your mana pool.

cards.name: Rampant Growth
cards.text: Search your library for a basic land card and put that card onto the battlefield tapped. Then shuffle your library.
cards.flavor: Rath forces plants from its surface as one presses whey from cheese.
cards.original_text: Search your library for a basic land card and put that card into play tapped. Then shuffle your library.

rulings.text: The land does not count toward your one per turn limit because it was put onto the battlefield by an effect.
Because the "search" requires you to find a card with certain characteristics, you don't have to find the card if you don't want to.

cards.name: Scaled Wurm
cards.flavor:
"Flourishing during the Ice Age, these wurms were the bane of all Kjeldorans. Their great size and ferocity made them the subject of countless nightmares—they embodied the worst of the Ice Age."
—Kjeldor: Ice Civilization

cards.name: Shambling Strider
cards.text: {R}{G}: Shambling Strider gets +1/-1 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: Freyalise forbid that any stranger should wander into the striders' territory.
cards.original_text: {R}{G}: Shambling Strider gets +1/-1 until end of turn.

cards.name: Wild Growth
cards.text:
Enchant land
Whenever enchanted land is tapped for mana, its controller adds an additional {G}.
cards.original_text: Whenever enchanted land is tapped for mana, its controller adds {G} to his or her mana pool.

rulings.text: The additional mana is not an ability of the land and is not something the land can produce.

cards.name: Woolly Spider
cards.text:
Reach (This creature can block creatures with flying.)
Whenever Woolly Spider blocks a creature with flying, Woolly Spider gets +0/+2 until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"We need not fear the forces of the air; I've yet to see a spider without an appetite."
—Taaveti of Kelsinko, elvish hunter
cards.original_text:
Woolly Spider may block as though it had flying.
Whenever Woolly Spider blocks a creature with flying, Woolly Spider gets +0/+2 until end of turn.

cards.name: Yavimaya Wurm
cards.text: Trample (This creature can deal excess combat damage to the player or planeswalker it's attacking.)
cards.flavor: When the gorilla playfully grabbed the wurm's tail, the wurm doubled back and playfully ate the gorilla's head.
cards.original_text: Trample

cards.name: Diabolic Vision
cards.text: Look at the top five cards of your library. Put one of them into your hand and the rest on top of your library in any order.
cards.flavor:
"I have seen the true path. I will not warm myself by the fire—I will become the flame."
—Lim-Dûl, the Necromancer
cards.original_text: Look at the top five cards of your library. Put one of them into your hand and the rest on top of your library in any order.

cards.name: Segmented Wurm
cards.text: Whenever Segmented Wurm becomes the target of a spell or ability, put a -1/-1 counter on it.
cards.flavor:
"If only we could so easily leave behind those parts of ourselves that pain us."
—Crovax
cards.original_text: Whenever Segmented Wurm becomes the target of a spell or ability, put a -1/-1 counter on it.

cards.name: Clockwork Avian
cards.text:
Flying
Clockwork Avian enters the battlefield with four +1/+0 counters on it.
At end of combat, if Clockwork Avian attacked or blocked this combat, remove a +1/+0 counter from it.
{X}, {T}: Put up to X +1/+0 counters on Clockwork Avian. This ability can't cause the total number of +1/+0 counters on Clockwork Avian to be greater than four. Activate this ability only during your upkeep.
cards.original_text:
Clockwork Avian comes into play with four +1/+0 counters on it.
Clockwork Avian can't have more than four +1/+0 counters on it.
At end of combat, if Clockwork Avian attacked or blocked this turn, remove a +1/+0 counter from it.
{X}, {T}: Put X +1/+0 counters on Clockwork Avian. Play this ability only during your upkeep.

rulings.text: Loses a counter even if it is affected by a Fog-like effect which prevents it from dealing damage.
Can attack or block even if it has no counters.
If the ability to add counters resolves when there are already the maximum number of counters on it, any counters over the maximum are simply not added.

cards.name: Clockwork Beast
cards.text:
Clockwork Beast enters the battlefield with seven +1/+0 counters on it.
At end of combat, if Clockwork Beast attacked or blocked this combat, remove a +1/+0 counter from it.
{X}, {T}: Put up to X +1/+0 counters on Clockwork Beast. This ability can't cause the total number of +1/+0 counters on Clockwork Beast to be greater than seven. Activate this ability only during your upkeep.
cards.original_text:
Clockwork Beast comes into play with seven +1/+0 counters on it.
Clockwork Beast can't have more than seven +1/+0 counters on it.
At end of combat, if Clockwork Beast attacked or blocked this turn, remove a +1/+0 counter from it.
{X}, {T}: Put X +1/+0 counters on Clockwork Beast. Play this ability only during your upkeep.

rulings.text: Loses a counter even if it is affected by a Fog-like effect which prevents it from dealing damage.
Can attack or block even if it has no counters.
This is a change from the most recent wording. Now, if some other spell or ability causes +1/+0 counters to be put on Clockwork Beast, it can wind up with more than seven such counters on it.

If Clockwork Beast has seven or fewer +1/+0 counters on it when its last ability resolves, it can wind up a maximum of seven such counters on it. If it has seven or more +1/+0 counters on it, the ability will have no effect.
Clockwork Beast's last ability resolves, you can choose to put fewer than X +1/+0 counters on it.

cards.name: Dwarven Ruins
cards.text:
Dwarven Ruins enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Add {R}.
{T}, Sacrifice Dwarven Ruins: Add {R}{R}.
cards.original_text:
